intro: Astragalus stenoceras, commonly known as narrow-capsule milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Mongolia, and Russia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish-white, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus stenoceras is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
